Aimé Simon-Girard https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aim%C3%A9_Simon-Girard 0 Aimé Simon-Girard (March 20, 1889 – July 15, 1950), in Paris, France was a French film actor. He was the son of the tenor Nicholas Simon-Max and the soprano Juliette Simon-Girard. He played a leading role as d'Artagnan in the silent film Les Trois Mousquetaires (1921), the first film adaptation of the novel and his screen breakthrough role. He starred in 20 films between 1921 and 1948. Aimé_Simon-Girard ( March_20_,_1889 – July_15_,_1950 ) , in Paris , France was a_French_film_actor . He was the_son of the_tenor_Nicholas_Simon-Max and the_soprano_Juliette_Simon-Girard . He played a_leading_role as d'Artagnan in the_silent_film_Les_Trois_Mousquetaires_(_1921_) , the_first_film_adaptation of the_novel and his_screen_breakthrough_role . He starred in_20_films between 1921_and_1948 .
